metadata.title: CVE-2019-14869 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in all versions of ghostscript 9.x before 9.50, where the`.charkeys` procedure, where it did not properly secure its privilegedcalls, enabling scripts to bypass `-dSAFER` restrictions. An attacker couldabuse this flaw by creating a specially crafted PostScript file that couldescalate privileges within the Ghostscript and access files outside ofrestricted areas or execute commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.12
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.12
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.12
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.12').
